channel.title: Comments on: Why no one wants to use your API

item.title: By: ajax jones (@ajaxjones)
item.dc:creator: ajax jones (@ajaxjones)
item.description: Totes agree. Just tried temboo, instructions included for Mac, and line that said windows might be similar, wasn't. Dire and error so gave up. Gone native
item.content:encoded: Totes agree. Just tried temboo, instructions included for Mac, and line that said windows might be similar, wasn’t. Dire and error so gave up. Gone native

item.title: By: Dark Matter in the API Universe | API UX
item.dc:creator: Dark Matter in the API Universe | API UX
item.description: […] as it could ensure your future API too expensive to refactor. I’ve posted on APIUX.com about “Why no one wants to use your API” as a series of warnings to today’s APIs. Most of these warnings are completely valid for […]

item.title: By: API User Experience Should Include The Operations Users - Openprise
item.dc:creator: API User Experience Should Include The Operations Users - Openprise
item.description: […] User experience is starting to be a hot topic even for API design; in other words, developer user experience. API UX has a great blog on why API usability is important and the key aspects of good API usability: “Why no one wants to use your API” […]
